title: Felicity Huffman released from prison after serving 11-day sentence
text:
Felicity Huffman has been released from prison early.

The actor, who had been sentenced to 14 days behind bars, walked free on Friday after serving 11 days.

A statement provided by the Federal Bureau of Prisons to The Independent states that Huffman was "released from the custody of the Bureau of Prisons today, 25 October, 2019”.

We’ll tell you what’s true. You can form your own view. From 15p €0.18 $0.18 USD 0.27 a day, more exclusives, analysis and extras.

The BOP's statement points to a rule stating that if an inmate's release date falls on a weekend or on a legal holiday, then they will be freed on the last preceding weekday instead.

Huffman began serving her sentence on 15 October. A previous report by TMZ stated that she would only serve 13 days, having already completed one day towards her sentence during pre-sentencing proceedings. This means he release date would have fallen on this coming Sunday.

More follows…
